author: protolambda
content:
Genesis info in a few hours I think.
Networking in nodes starts as soon as that's known. Started a multi-client testnet yesterday, and it worked fine, even with only 15 minutes between it getting a genesis info, and actual genesis event.

author: protolambda
content: for me it logged: `time="2020-08-02 15:35:43" level=debug msg="Received state initialized event" prefix=sync starttime=2020-08-04 15:00:08 +0200 CEST` (after lowering the follow distance to make sure to get the number quick)

author: protolambda
content: So that would be 4 August `13:00:08` UTC indeed. With the 8 seconds offset caused by the timing of the triggering Eth1 block today. Fort the real mainnet thing, I wouldn't mind changing it to align nicely to the hour, but we can talk about that later.

author: ryg9705
content: What I miss from clients is having a javascript console that can I attach to and run commands against the running client like adding a peer manually like with geth.

author: protolambda
content:
<@!134118181710200833> It's not a fully running client, and the sync is still work in progress, but Rumor has an interactive shell to mess with a lot of the Eth2 tech stack: https://github.com/protolambda/rumor
There's not much use for an interactive client yet other than tweaking/hacking things on the go, as the phase0 functionality is limited to staking, and clients are looking at a GUI solution instead (which uses the client http API), if you need to change things on a running client.

author: protolambda
content: Afaik Teku is still making bad metadata requests, sending extra zero bytes, for what should be an empty request.

author: protolambda
content: <@!340345049063882753> as reported earlier, it's now live on Medalla, and prysm is having problems with it

author: protolambda
content: The good news is that it won't prevent Teku from participating, is being fixed, and with lighthouse on the network as bridge, it can still result in participation. Just not votes for the most recent head of the chain

author: djrtwo
content: I'm seeing `e7a75d5a`

author: protolambda
content: for the uninitiated: there are two fork digests: one of bootnodes that mix a zeroed validators root with the fork version. And one with the real validators root mixed with fork version

author: donschoe
content: that one? `0xe7a75d5a00000001ffffffffffffffff`

author: djrtwo
content: the first 4 bytes of that is the fork digest

author: djrtwo
content: then fork version

author: protolambda
content: Yes, 2nd field is next-fork-version, last (The all 0xff data) is next-fork-epoch

author: donschoe
content: nice

author: djrtwo
content: then "next fork version"

author: djrtwo
content: which in aggregate signals which eth2 network you think you're on
